body:
Hello all,

This has been a thread I have wanted to make for a while now. Basically, what I am asking from you guys is to provide ideas of what you would want in the upcoming tournaments. This could range from gamemodes to maps. 

In addition, I have made a poll asking if you would like frequent, small tournaments, such as 1-2 weekend tournaments with different game modes or large, but less tournaments such as the Omega Championship. 

Any my comments that are offensive, unrelated to the discussion or spam will be deleted. Failure to follow these rules could warrant a harsher punishment. We want this to be a constructive thread. Thank you.

Regards,
The Event Coordinators
body_tagged:

In addition, I have made a poll asking if you would like frequent, small tournaments, such as 1-2 weekend tournaments with different game modes or large, but less tournaments such as the Omega Championship. 

Any my comments that are offensive, unrelated to the discussion or spam will be deleted. Failure to follow these rules could warrant a harsher punishment. We want this to be a constructive thread. Thank you.

Regards,
The Event Coordinators
title: Ideas for Upcoming Tournament(s)!

replies.body: Can we have smaller tournaments first off. To test maps, make sure the plugin works for new maps, and other things. And have bigger tournaments that last longer, have the best maps Avicus can supply, and to make sure the tournament plays well

replies.body: But those mean nothing in the long run. I want small tournaments that mean something and big ones that mean something. Take OCN for example also(Oh noes OCN AHHHHHHH). replies.body: I agree with Pie, we need small, official tourneys/events to make sure everything works and then the big, important tournaments like the Omega Championship. As much as people think the unofficial ECs are doing a better job, it's hard to take unofficial events seriously, we need the actual ECs to be in charge of the smaller events as well. We could have small tournaments every 1-3 weeks and then the big tournaments like 4-6 weeks after a small one. It would also help the server grow, I've seen the player count go up to 150~ on weekends when the unofficial events are going on, now imagine if they were OFFICIAL events? The competitive community is what keeps the server alive...
replies.body_tagged: I agree with Pie, we need small, official tourneys/events to make sure everything works and then the big, important tournaments like the Omega Championship. As much as people think the unofficial ECs are doing a better job, it's hard to take unofficial events seriously, we need the actual ECs to be in charge of the smaller events as well. We could have small tournaments every 1-3 weeks and then the big tournaments like 4-6 weeks after a small one. It would also help the server grow, I've seen the player count go up to 150~ on weekends when the unofficial events are going on, now imagine if they were OFFICIAL events? The competitive community is what keeps the server alive...

replies.body:
We really should have an event every month. This will attract more players and bring excitement to the server. I would say a small event, followed by a large event or even 2 small events followed by a larger one.

These smaller events could be used to try out tournaments for different game modes like Walls, CTH and even SG!

replies.body:
Just get tournament's sorted, have people who's entire job on the server is to just organise the events, (I'm not trying to suggest myself because i want to play in events). 

As for the next tournament, CTW,  less teams invited because last time it lead to way too many no-shows and an overall pathetic tourney.

Give more updates concerning events as we know nothing about them until the literal week before.

replies.body:
^ I agree can we please get the no show shit sorted


personally a major tournament every 4 to 6 months would seem nice and maybe 2 smaller events between them, however we have to be careful not to 

a. Hold them too often otherwise they'll lose the excitement value and become mainstream, "another tournament, nothing new"

b. don't have massive gaps between tourneys, cause ppl get bored
